think_procedure.step2: Understand the function of 'statement_timeout': it sets the maximum allowed duration (in milliseconds) of any statement. After this time, the statement is aborted.
think_procedure.step3: Determine if 'statement_timeout' has a special value that changes its behavior significantly. In PostgreSQL, setting 'statement_timeout' to 0 disables the timeout, meaning statements can run indefinitely.
think_procedure.step4: Conclude that 'statement_timeout' is a special knob because setting it to 0 changes its behavior from enforcing a timeout to disabling the timeout feature.
